meanings.definition: The process of representing a language in the Roman alphabet.
meanings.sent1: Romanization helps people read languages written in different alphabets.
meanings.sent2: In school, we learned about the romanization of ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: The Romanization of the menu made it easier for tourists to order food.
meanings.sent4: The romanization of the street signs made navigating the city much simpler.
meanings.sent5: The romanization of Chinese characters into pinyin was a significant step in language education.

meanings.definition: The act of transliterating a non-Roman script into Roman letters.
meanings.sent1: The romanization of Japanese kanji into romaji is common in language classes.
meanings.sent2: She specialized in the romanization of ancient hieroglyphics.
meanings.sent3: The romanization of emojis into text can lead to funny misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: His love letter was like a romanization of his feelings, clear and direct.
meanings.sent5: The romanization of Arabic script into English letters requires attention to detail.
